quote.text: Blessed is that teacher who shall arise to instruct the children …
quote.author: Bahá’u’lláh
quote.reference: Bahá’í Education - A Compilation p.9 (Book 3, p. 7)

quote.text: Among the greatest of all services that can possibly be rendered by man to Almighty God is the education and training of children….
quote.author: ‘Abdu’l-Bahá
quote.reference: Selections From The Writings of ‘Abdu’l-Baha #106 p.133 (Book 3, p. 7)

quote.text: According to the explicit divine Text, teaching the children is indispensable and obligatory. It followeth that teachers are servants of the Lord God, since they have arisen to perform this task, which is the same as worship. You must therefore offer praise with each breath, for you are educating your spiritual children.
quote.author: ‘Abdu’l-Bahá
quote.reference: Bahá’í Education: A Compilation, p.33 (Book 3, p. 7)

quote.text: Regard man as a mine rich in gems of inestimable value. Education can, alone, cause it to reveal its treasures, and enable mankind to benefit therefrom.
quote.author: Bahá’u’lláh
quote.reference: Gleanings from the Writings of Bahá’u’lláh, p. 260 (Book 3, p. 9)

quote.text: Whoso ariseth among you to teach the Cause of his Lord, let him, before all else, teach his own self, that his speech may attract the hearts of them that hear him.
quote.author: Bahá’u’lláh
quote.reference: Gleanings from the Writings of Bahá’u’lláh CXXVIII p. 277 (Book 3, p. 13)

quote.text: Let God be your fear, O people, and be ye of them that tread the path of righteousness.
quote.author: Bahá’u’lláh
quote.reference: Gleanings from the Writings of Bahá’u’lláh CXXVIII p.275 (Book 3, p. 16)

quote.text: O God, guide me, protect me, make of me a shining lamp and a brilliant star. Thou art the Mighty and the Powerful.
quote.author: ‘Abdu’l-Bahá
quote.reference: Bahá’í Prayers (1985 U.S. Edition) p.37 (Book 3, p. 37)

quote.text: So powerful is the light of unity that it can illumine the whole earth.
quote.author: Bahá’u’lláh
quote.reference: Gleanings from the Writings of Bahá’u’lláh CXXXII p. 288 (Book 3, p. 38)

quote.text: O Son of Spirit! My first counsel is this: Possess a pure, kindly and radiant heart …
quote.author: Bahá’u’lláh
quote.reference: Hidden Words, Arabic #1 (Book 3, p. 40)

quote.text: Tread ye the path of justice, for this, verily, is the straight path.
quote.author: Bahá’u’lláh
quote.reference: Gleanings from the Writings of Bahá’u’lláh CXVIII p.250 (Book 3, p.43)

quote.text: O Friend! In the garden of thy heart plant naught but the rose of love …
quote.author: Bahá’u’lláh
quote.reference: Hidden Words, Persian #3 (Book 3, p. 45)

quote.text: O Thou kind Lord! I am a little child, exalt me by admitting me to the kingdom. I am earthly, make me heavenly; I am of the world below, let me belong to the realm above; gloomy, suffer me to become radiant; material, make me spiritual, and grant that I may manifest Thine infinite bounties. Thou art the Powerful, the All-Loving.
quote.author: `Abdu'l-Baha
quote.reference: Bahá'í Prayers, p. 35

quote.text: That one indeed is a man who, today, dedicateth himself to the service of the entire human race.
quote.author: Bahá’u’lláh
quote.reference: leanings from the Writings of Bahá’u’lláh CXVII p.250 (Book 3, p. 47)

quote.text: Truthfulness is the foundation of all human virtues.
quote.author: Bahá’u’lláh
quote.reference: cited in Shoghi Effendi, The Advent of Divine Justice, 1984 U.S. Edition p.26 (Book 3, p. 49)

quote.text: Supremely lofty will be thy station, if thou remainest steadfast in the Cause of thy Lord.
quote.author: Bahá’u’lláh
quote.reference: Gleanings from the Writings of Bahá’u’lláh CXV p.246 (Book 3, p. 51)

quote.text: O Son of Man! Humble thyself before Me, that I may graciously visit thee.
quote.author: Bahá’u’lláh
quote.reference: Hidden Words, Arabic #42 (Book 3, p. 54)

quote.text: Blessed is he who preferreth his brother before himself.
quote.author: Bahá’u’lláh
quote.reference: Tablets of Bahá’u’lláh Revealed after The Kitáb-i-Aqdas, p.71 (Book 3, 56)

quote.text: Beautify your tongues, O people, with truthfulness, and adorn your souls with the ornament of honesty.
quote.author: Bahá’u’lláh
quote.reference: Gleanings from the Writings of Bahá’u’lláh CXXXVI p. 297 (Book 3, p. 58)

quote.text: O my Lord! O my Lord! I am a child of tender years. Nourish me from the breast of Thy mercy, train me in the bosom of Thy love, educate me in the school of Thy guidance and develop me under the shadow of Thy bounty. Deliver me from darkness, make me a brilliant light; free me from unhappiness, make me a flower of the rose garden; suffer me to become a servant of Thy threshold and confer upon me the disposition and nature of the righteous; make me a cause of bounty to the human world and crown my head with the diadem of eternal life. Verily, Thou art the Powerful, the Mighty, the Seer, the Hearer.
quote.author: ‘Abdu’l-Bahá
quote.reference: Bahá’í Prayers pp.37/38 (Book 3, p. 60)

quote.text: To give and be generous are attributes of Mine; well it is with him that adorneth himself with My virtues.
quote.author: Bahá’u’lláh
quote.reference: Hidden Words, Persian #49 (Book 3, p. 61)

quote.text: Blessed is he who mingleth with all men in a spirit of utmost kindliness and love.
quote.author: Bahá’u’lláh
quote.reference: Gleanings from the Writings of Bahá’u’lláh CLVI p334 (Book 3, p. 63)

quote.text: The sign of love is fortitude under My decree and patience under My trials.
quote.author: Bahá’u’lláh
quote.reference: Hidden Words, Arabic, #48 (Book 3, p. 65)

quote.text: O Son of Being! My love is My stronghold; he that entereth therein is safe and secure, and he that turneth away shall surely stray and perish.
quote.author: Bahá’u’lláh
quote.reference: Hidden Words, Arabic #9 (Book 3, p. 68)

quote.text: Put your trust in God, and commit your affairs to His keeping.
quote.author: Bahá’u’lláh
quote.reference: cited in Shoghi Effendi,The Advent of Divine Justice,1984 U.S. Edition p.82 (Book 3, p. 71)
